thread.title: Germany’s Axel Springer in Talks to Acquire Business Insider
thread.title_full: Germany’s Axel Springer in Talks to Acquire Business Insider - WSJ

author: Lukas I. Alpert
title: Germany’s Axel Springer in Talks to Acquire Business Insider
text:
Germany’s Axel Springer SE is in talks to acquire Business Insider in a deal that would value the U.S. digital publisher at roughly $500 million, according to a person familiar with the matter, the latest tie-up between old-media and new-media firms.
Axel Springer is a print media giant whose flagship newspapers include Welt and Bild. The company is seeking new growth avenues through investments in areas such as marketing and online media, and has sought out overseas acquisitions. In July, the company made a failed...
